jcr:content.jcr:title: List of ships named HMS Endeavour

contentheadline.headline: List of ships named HMS Endeavour

contentrichtext.text: '''HMS ''Endeavour''''' may refer to one of the following ships: ;In the Royal Navy: *{{HMS|Endeavour|1652|6}}, a 36-gun ship purchased in 1652 and sold in 1656 *{{HMS|Endeavour|1694 bomb vessel|6}}, a 4-gun [[bomb vessel]] purchased in 1694 and sold in 1696 *{{HMS|Endeavour|1694 fire ship|6}}, a [[fire ship]] purchased in 1694 and sold in 1696 *{{HMS|Endeavour|1694 hoy|6}}, a storeship [[hoy (boat)|hoy]] purchased in 1694 and sold in 1705 *{{HMS|Endeavour Transport|1708|6}}, a storeship launched in 1708 and sold in 1713 *{{HMS|Endeavour|1763 cutter|6}}, a [[Cutter (boat)|cutter]] purchased in 1763 and sold in 1771 *{{HMS|Endeavour|1763 sloop|6}}, a 14-gun [[sloop-of-war|sloop]], purchased in 1763 and foundered in 1780 in a [[hurricane]] off [[Jamaica]] *{{ship|HM Bark|Endeavour}}, originally ''Earl of Pembroke'', a 10-gun [[barque|bark]] purchased in 1768; known as ''Endeavour Bark'' to distinguish her from her contemporaries listed above; was commanded by Lieutenant [[James Cook]] in his first voyage of exploration to the [[Pacific]], 1768â€“1771; sold in 1775 ** {{ship|HM Bark|Endeavour|replica}}, a sailing replica of Cook's ''Endeavour'' *{{HMS|Endeavour|1775|6}}, a [[schooner]] purchased in 1775 and sold in 1782 *{{HMS|Endeavour|1782|6}}, another [[schooner]] purchased in 1782; there may have been other brigs or schooners obtained in the West Indies during this period, as the name was retained for several replacement vessels *{{HMS|Endeavour|1912|6}}, a [[survey ship]] launched in 1912, used as a [[depot ship]] from 1940, and sold in 1946 ;In the Royal New Zealand Navy: * {{ship|HMNZS|Endeavour|1956}}, which served as the Antarctic support vessel from 1956 to 1962 * {{USS|Namakagon|AOG-53}}, which served as the Antarctic support vessel HMNZS ''Endeavour'' from 1962 to 1971 * {{ship|HMNZS|Endeavour|A11}}, a fleet tanker commissioned in 1988, and in active service ;Other *{{ship|F.I.S.|Endeavour}} (F.I.S.=Fisheries Investigation Ship), trawler, Sank 5 December 1914 near [[Macquarie Island]] ;In popular culture: * In the 2007 film [[Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End]], the fictional HMS ''Endeavour'' appears as the flagship of [[Lord]] [[Cutler Beckett]] and the [[East India Trading Company]]. ==See also== * ''[[Apollo 15]]'' Command Module, the first NASA vessel named in honor of [[James Cook]]'s HM Bark ''Endeavour'' * Space Shuttle ''[[Space Shuttle Endeavour|Endeavour]]'', the second NASA vessel named in honor of [[James Cook]]'s HM Bark ''Endeavour'' * [[HMNZS Endeavour]], several ships of the name * [[Endeavour (disambiguation)]] {{Shipindex}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:HMS ''Endeavour'' (disambiguation)}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Endeavour, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]] [[sl:HMS Endeavour]]
